title: 109_hr518
content: The Act is titled the "Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Improvement Act of 2006" and includes amendments to the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include birds that breed in Canada and the United States, expand the definition of the Caribbean to include Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands, and define the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include Canada in conservation projects, increase cost-sharing to 50 percent, and specify cash payments for projects in the United States and Canada. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include Latin America and the Caribbean in conservation projects, allowing the non-Federal share to be paid in cash or in kind. An advisory group with expertise in conservation methods in the Western Hemisphere is encouraged to convene within 6 months of the Act's effective date. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to change the report deadline and the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to change the report deadline and the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund. SEC. 9. NEOTROPICAL MIGRATORY BIRD CONSERVATION FUND. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund is established in the Treasury as a separate account for donations and appropriations. Administrative expenses are increased to $150,000. Amendments are made to the Act regarding fund deposits and conforming amendments. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund is established in the Treasury as a separate account for donations and appropriations. Amendments are made to the Act regarding fund deposits and administrative expenses. The Secretary of the Treasury may transfer amounts to the Fund from the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Account. Authorization of appropriations is also amended. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund is established with specified amounts for fiscal years 2006 to 2010. Appropriated amounts can remain available until expended, with a minimum of 75 percent for projects outside the United States. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund was established with specified amounts for fiscal years 2006 to 2010. The bill was passed by the House of Representatives on May 16, 2006.
